title: Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set

field_clinical_specialization_extension_.name: clinical_specialization_extension_query
field_clinical_specialization_extension_.label: Is this clinical specialization part of the UAMS Health extension to the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set?
field_clinical_specialization_extension_.instructions: Answer "Yes" if this is a clinical specialization that is not a part of the core Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set found at https://taxonomy.nucc.org/.

field_clinical_specialization_tab_extens.label: Qualifications for Inclusion in the UAMS Health Extension to the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set

field_clinical_specialization_extension_.name: clinical_specialization_extension_national_query
field_clinical_specialization_extension_.label: Applies Nationally
field_clinical_specialization_extension_.instructions: The clinical specialization applies at a national level and is not restricted to local use.

field_clinical_specialization_extension_.name: clinical_specialization_extension_unique_query
field_clinical_specialization_extension_.label: Unique Need
field_clinical_specialization_extension_.instructions: The clinical specialization meets a unique need that is well-defined and separate and distinct from other clinical specializations currently in the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set.

field_clinical_specialization_extension_.name: clinical_specialization_extension_org_query
field_clinical_specialization_extension_.label: Organizational Unit Supports the Addition
field_clinical_specialization_extension_.instructions: The addition of the specialization has the support of the related UAMS organizational unit(s), if applicable.

field_clinical_specialization_extension_.name: clinical_specialization_extension_provider_type
field_clinical_specialization_extension_.label: Provider Type
field_clinical_specialization_extension_.instructions: Identify the type of provider impacted by this new clinical specialization.

choices.md-do: Medical doctors (M.D.) or doctors of osteopathy (D.O.)

field_clinical_specialization_extension_.name: clinical_specialization_extension_authority
field_clinical_specialization_extension_.label: Recognizing Authority

choices.board-certification-abms: The area of specialty is recognized for certification by the American Board of Medical Specialties.
choices.board-certification-aoa: The area of specialty is recognized for certification by the American Osteopathic Association certifying boards  or conjoint examination committees.
choices.training-program-acgme: There is an accredited residency/fellowship specialty/subspecialty training program by the Accreditation Council for Graduate Medical Education.
choices.training-program-aoa: There is an accredited residency/fellowship specialty/subspecialty training program by AOA-accredited Osteopathic Graduate Medical Education.

field_clinical_specialization_extension_.name: clinical_specialization_extension_board
field_clinical_specialization_extension_.label: Name of the Member Board, Certifying Board or Conjoint Examination Committee
field_clinical_specialization_extension_.instructions:
Member board of the American Board of Medical Specialties, American Osteopathic Association certifying board or American Osteopathic Association conjoint examination committee recognizing the area of specialty.

The names of member boards, specialty certificates and subspecialty certificates can be found at https://www.abms.org/member-boards/specialty-subspecialty-certificates/.

Information on the certifying boards, conjoint examination committees, specialty certificates and subspecialty certificates can be found at https://certification.osteopathic.org/.

field_clinical_specialization_extension_.name: clinical_specialization_extension_board_url
field_clinical_specialization_extension_.label: Official Webpage Concerning the Member Board, Certifying Board or Conjoint Examination Committee Certificate
field_clinical_specialization_extension_.instructions:
Webpage with information on the member board of the American Board of Medical Specialties, American Osteopathic Association certifying board or American Osteopathic Association conjoint examination committee recognizing the area of specialty.

The names of member boards, specialty certificates and subspecialty certificates can be found at https://www.abms.org/member-boards/specialty-subspecialty-certificates/.

Information on the certifying boards, conjoint examination committees, specialty certificates and subspecialty certificates can be found at https://certification.osteopathic.org/.

field_clinical_specialization_extension_.name: clinical_specialization_extension_board_certificate
field_clinical_specialization_extension_.label: Name of Specialty Certificate or Subspecialty Certificate
field_clinical_specialization_extension_.instructions:
Name of the specialty certificate or subspecialty certificate from the member board of the American Board of Medical Specialties, American Osteopathic Association certifying board or American Osteopathic Association conjoint examination committee recognizing the area of specialty..

Information on the member boards, specialty certificates and subspecialty certificates can be found at https://www.abms.org/member-boards/specialty-subspecialty-certificates/.

The names of certifying boards, conjoint examination committees, specialty certificates and subspecialty certificates can be found at https://certification.osteopathic.org/.

field_clinical_specialization_extension_.name: clinical_specialization_extension_board_certificate_url
field_clinical_specialization_extension_.label: Official Webpage Concerning the Specialty Certificate or Subspecialty Certificate
field_clinical_specialization_extension_.instructions:
Webpage with information on the specialty certificate or subspecialty certificate from the member board of the American Board of Medical Specialties, American Osteopathic Association certifying board or American Osteopathic Association conjoint examination committee recognizing the area of specialty..

Information on the member boards, specialty certificates and subspecialty certificates can be found at https://www.abms.org/member-boards/specialty-subspecialty-certificates/.

The names of certifying boards, conjoint examination committees, specialty certificates and subspecialty certificates can be found at https://certification.osteopathic.org/.

field_clinical_specialization_extension_.name: clinical_specialization_extension_training_type
field_clinical_specialization_extension_.label: Training Type
field_clinical_specialization_extension_.instructions: Identify the type of training program.

field_clinical_specialization_extension_.name: clinical_specialization_extension_training_distinct_query
field_clinical_specialization_extension_.label: The training requirements demonstrate that the provider has a recognized area of specialty / subspecialty that is separate and distinct from others.

field_clinical_specialization_extension_.name: clinical_specialization_extension_training_level
field_clinical_specialization_extension_.label: Training Level
field_clinical_specialization_extension_.instructions: Identify the specificity of the training program.

field_clinical_specialization_extension_.name: clinical_specialization_extension_training_specialty
field_clinical_specialization_extension_.label: Name of the Training Program's Specialty
field_clinical_specialization_extension_.instructions: For the Accreditation Council for Graduate Medical Education, this information can be found at https://www.acgme.org/specialties/.

field_clinical_specialization_extension_.name: clinical_specialization_extension_training_subspecialty
field_clinical_specialization_extension_.label: Name of the Training Program's Subspecialty
field_clinical_specialization_extension_.instructions: For the Accreditation Council for Graduate Medical Education, this information can be found in the specialty sections linked at https://www.acgme.org/specialties/.

field_clinical_specialization_extension_.name: clinical_specialization_extension_training_url
field_clinical_specialization_extension_.label: Official Webpage Concerning the Training Program's Specialty/Subspecialty

field_clinical_specialization_extension_.name: clinical_specialization_extension_training_accreditation_query
field_clinical_specialization_extension_.label: The training program is accredited by a third party.

field_clinical_specialization_extension_.name: clinical_specialization_extension_training_accreditation_org
field_clinical_specialization_extension_.label: Name of the Third Party Accrediting Organization

field_clinical_specialization_extension_.name: clinical_specialization_extension_training_accreditation_org_url
field_clinical_specialization_extension_.label: Official Website of the Third Party Accrediting Organization

field_clinical_specialization_extension_.name: clinical_specialization_extension_accrediting_authority_query
field_clinical_specialization_extension_.label: The third party accrediting organization establishes training program requirements, conducts periodic reviews of the programs, and has the authority to sanction programs.

field_clinical_specialization_extension_.name: clinical_specialization_extension_examination_query
field_clinical_specialization_extension_.label: A certification examination is required for graduates of the specialty / subspecialty training program to earn the designation.

field_clinical_specialization_tab_code_s.label: Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set

field_clinical_specialization_code_set_e.label: Field Values for UAMS Health Extension to the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set
field_clinical_specialization_code_set_e.message: Enter the values in the fields below as if this clinical specialization was part of the core code set.

field_clinical_specialization_code_query.name: clinical_specialization_code_query
field_clinical_specialization_code_query.label: Does this specailization have a taxonomy code in the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set?

field_clinical_specialization_code.name: clinical_specialization_code
field_clinical_specialization_code.label: Specialization Taxonomy Code in the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set
field_clinical_specialization_code.instructions:
This information can be found in the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set at https://taxonomy.nucc.org/.

Example: "207LA0401X".

field_clinical_specialization_name.name: clinical_specialty_name
field_clinical_specialization_name.label: Specialization Name in the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set
field_clinical_specialization_name.instructions:
This information can be found in the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set at https://taxonomy.nucc.org/.

Example: "Addiction Medicine" for taxonomy code 207LA0401X.

field_clinical_specialization_name_displ.name: clinical_specialization_name_display
field_clinical_specialization_name_displ.label: Specialization Display Name in the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set
field_clinical_specialization_name_displ.instructions:
This information can be found in the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set at https://taxonomy.nucc.org/.

Example: "Addiction Medicine (Anesthesiology) Physician" for taxonomy code 207LA0401X.

field_clinical_specialization_valid.name: clinical_specialization_valid
field_clinical_specialization_valid.label: Is this clinical specialization a valid selection?
field_clinical_specialization_valid.instructions: Some taxonomy codes are strictly grouping codes for taxonomy codes within their group, and are not to be used as a taxonomy code (e.g., Pathology [207Z00000X]). One of the other codes within their group that describes provider practice, training and certification must be used instead.

field_clinical_specialization_title.name: clinical_specialization_title
field_clinical_specialization_title.label: Clinical Occupation Title Based on the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set
field_clinical_specialization_title.instructions:
Determine the patient-facing clinical occupation title to be used for this specialization based on its name, context and description in the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set; the word choices used by the certifying organization; and standard nomenclature.

Example: "Addiction Medicine Anesthesiologist" for taxonomy code 207LA0401X.

field_clinical_specialization_definition.name: clinical_specialization_definition
field_clinical_specialization_definition.label: Specialization Definition in the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set
field_clinical_specialization_definition.placeholder: e.g., An anesthesiologist who specializes in the diagnosis and treatment of addictions.

field_clinical_specialization_definition.name: clinical_specialization_definition_source
field_clinical_specialization_definition.label: Source of Specialization Definition in the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set

field_clinical_specialization_cms_code_s.label: How to Find the CMS Specialty Code
field_clinical_specialization_cms_code_s.message:
The official list of specialty codes can be found in Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services Publication 100-06: Medicare Financial Management Manual; Chapter 6: Medicare Administrator Contractor (MAC) Financial Reports; Section 400.3: Specialty Codes.

Find which CMS specialty code is paired with each taxonomy code at Data.CMS.gov in the Medicare Provider and Supplier Taxonomy Crosswalk.

It can also be found on NPIdb.org on each taxonomy code page (e.g., https://npidb.org/taxonomy/207LA0401X/).

field_clinical_specialization_cms_code_t.name: clinical_specialization_cms_code_type
field_clinical_specialization_cms_code_t.label: Related CMS Provider/Supplier Type
field_clinical_specialization_cms_code_t.instructions:
Include "Physician/" at the beginning if the specialty code is in the list of Physician/Limited License Physician Specialty Codes.

Examples: "Physician/Addiction Medicine" for taxonomy code 207LA0401X, "Certified Nurse Midwife" for taxonomy code 367A00000X.

field_clinical_specialization_onetsoc_ab.label: About O*Net-SOC
field_clinical_specialization_onetsoc_ab.message:
The Occupational Information Network — or O*NET — is a free online database that contains hundreds of job definitions to help students, job seekers, businesses and workforce development professionals to understand today's world of work in the United States.

O*NET classifies jobs in job families (functional areas which include workers from entry level to advanced, and may include several sub-specialties).

All O*NET occupations conform to the Standard Occupational Classification — or SOC — the United States government system of classifying occupations.

field_clinical_specialization_onetsoc_co.label: How to Find the O*Net-SOC Occupation Code

field_clinical_specialization_onetsoc_co.name: clinical_specialization_onetsoc_code
field_clinical_specialization_onetsoc_co.label: Related O*Net-SOC Occupation Code
field_clinical_specialization_onetsoc_co.instructions: Example: "29-1211.00" — the code for Anesthesiologists — for taxonomy code 207LA0401X (Addiction Medicine [Anesthesiology] Physician).

field_clinical_specialization_onetsoc_co.name: clinical_specialization_onetsoc_code_name
field_clinical_specialization_onetsoc_co.label: Related O*Net-SOC Occupation Name
field_clinical_specialization_onetsoc_co.instructions: Example: "Anesthesiologists" — the name associated with the code 29-1211.00 — for taxonomy code 207LA0401X (Addiction Medicine [Anesthesiology] Physician).

field_clinical_specialization_isco08_abo.label: About ISCO-08
field_clinical_specialization_isco08_abo.message: The International Standard Classification of Occupations — or ISCO — is an International Labour Organization classification structure for organizing information on labour and jobs. It is part of the international family of economic and social classifications of the United Nations. The current version is known as ISCO-08.

field_clinical_specialization_isco08_cod.label: Information About Each ISCO-08 Code
field_clinical_specialization_isco08_cod.message: For descriptions and examples of each occupation, see pages 82-108 of "ISCO-08 Part 3: Definitions of Major Groups, Sub-Major Groups, Minor Groups and Unit Groups" at https://www.ilo.org/public/english/bureau/stat/isco/docs/groupdefn08.pdf (archived at https://archive.is/TTr4R).

choices.2263: Environmental and Occupational Health and Hygiene Professionals (2263)

field_clinical_specialization_tab_wikida.label: About Wikidata
field_clinical_specialization_tab_wikida.message: Wikidata is a free and open knowledge base that can be read and edited by both humans and machines. Wikidata acts as central storage for the structured data of its Wikimedia sister projects including Wikipedia, Wikivoyage, Wiktionary, Wikisource, and others. Wikidata also provides support to many other sites and services beyond just Wikimedia projects! The content of Wikidata is available under a free license, exported using standard formats, and can be interlinked to other open data sets on the linked data web.

field_clinical_specialization_tab_wikida.label: How to Find the Related Wikidata Item
field_clinical_specialization_tab_wikida.message: Search for the item at https://www.wikidata.org/.

field_clinical_specialization_wikidata_u.name: clinical_specialization_wikidata_url_occupation
field_clinical_specialization_wikidata_u.label: Wikidata Item URL For the Occupation
field_clinical_specialization_wikidata_u.instructions: Example: "https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q28837" — the URL for "anesthesiologist" — for taxonomy code 207LA0401X (Addiction Medicine [Anesthesiology] Physician).

field_clinical_specialization_wikidata_u.name: clinical_specialization_wikidata_url_field
field_clinical_specialization_wikidata_u.label: Wikidata Item URL For the Specialty / Field
field_clinical_specialization_wikidata_u.instructions:
The field is often linked from a section titled "field of this occupation" on the Wikidata item page for the occupation.

Example: "https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q28837" — the URL for "anesthesiologist" — for taxonomy code 207LA0401X (Addiction Medicine [Anesthesiology] Physician).
